tool.name: MACS2 bdgcmp
tool.description: Deduct noise by comparing two signal tracks in bedGraph
tool.command:
@home_dir@ macs2 bdgcmp -t '${ infile_treatment }' -c '${ infile_control }'
-m '${ bdgcmp_options.bdgcmp_options_selector }' #if str($bdgcmp_options.bdgcmp_options_selector) in ['FE', 'logFE', 'logLR']: -p '${ bdgcmp_options.pseudocount }' #end if -o '${ outfile }'

param.name: bdgcmp_options_selector
param.label: Method to use while calculating a score in any bin by comparing treatment value and control value
param.help: Available choices are: ppois, qpois, subtract, logFE, logLR, and slogLR. They represent Poisson Pvalue (-log10(pvalue) form) using control as lambda and treatment as observation, q-value through a BH process for poisson pvalues, subtraction from treatment, linear scale fold enrichment, log10 fold enrichment(need to set pseudocount), log10 likelihood between ChIP-enriched model and open chromatin model(need to set pseudocount), symmetric log10 likelihood between two ChIP-enrichment models, or maximum value between the two tracks. Default=ppois (--method).
param.option: Poisson pvalue (-log10) using control as lambda and treatment as observation (ppois)
q-value through a BH process for poisson pvalues (qpois)
log10 likelihood between ChIP-enriched model and open chromatin model (logLR)
symmetric log10 likelihood between two ChIP-enrichment models (slogLR)

param.name: pseudocount
param.label: Set pseudocount
param.help: The count will be applied after normalization of sequencing depth. Default=0.0 (no pseudocount is applied).

param.name: pseudocount
param.label: Set pseudocount
param.help: The count will be applied after normalization of sequencing depth. Default=0.0 (no pseudocount is applied).

param.name: pseudocount

param.help: The count will be applied after normalization of sequencing depth. Default=0.0 (no pseudocount is applied).

tool.help:
**What it does**
This is **bdgcmp** utility from the MACS2_ Package. It is designed to deduct noise by comparing two signal tracks in bedGraph.
